intro: Calonyction bona-nox var. lobatum, commonly known as the night-blooming moonflower, is a striking plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night and close by morning. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its rapid blooming cycle. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and glossy, while the stems are hairy and woody. This variant, lobatum, is distinguished by its lobed leaves, adding to its ornamental appeal.
